zone.line: rise at the same period to us: he
must not say, looking at the setting
moo crescent of the moon, "Mathilda
now watches its fall." â€“ No, all must be
changed. Be it light with him when
it is darkness with me! Let him feel
the sun of summer while I am chilled
by the snows of winter! Let there be
the distance of the antipodes between
us!
At length the east began to brighten,
and the comfortable light of morning
streamed into my ^room. I was weary w with
watching and for some time I had
combated with the heavy sleep that
weighed down my eyelids: but now, no
longer fearful, I threw myself on my
bed. I sought for repose although I
did not hope for forgetfulness; I knew
I should be pursued by dreams, but did
not dread the frightful one that I
really hand had. I thought that I had
